content: goose sweater pattern porch geese have been a popular porch decoration for a while now however it s just been this past christmas where my daughter and i have owned one so obviously i wanted to get goostavo decorated asap i couldn t find a pattern that i liked so i worked on this to see where it would go i may work on additional sweaters as there are parts that could be improved the nice thing is this is a very simple pattern and can be easily modifiable i added the psu lettering from a cross stitch designing website i found online and i contrasted the ribbed edges please enjoy and share pictures items needed #8 circular needles i used magic loop to begin but then transferred to shorter circular needles #6 circular needles if desired i wanted to make the bottom ribbing a bit tighter so i switches to #6 needles worsted weight yarn i used less than a skein of red heart super saver 4 stitch markers cast on using #8 circular needles and german cast-on cast on 40 stitches join in the round neck ribbing work 2x2 ribbing until the piece measures 5 inches 13 cm from cast on edge i wanted a rolled down neck if you don t want this option you can just make the ribbed section shorter increase round 1 knit 1 round placing a stitch marker every 10 stitches round 2 knit 1 m1l knit to one stitch before the stitch marker m1r k slip marker k m1l repeat until there is 1 stitch left in the round m1r k repeat rounds 1 & 2 until piece measures 3 inches 8cm from the last neck ribbing round body knit in the round until the piece measures 7 inches from the last ribbed round decrease round 1 *knit one ssk knit until there are three stitches before the stitch marker k2tog knit repeat from * until there are three stitches remaining k2tog knit round 2 knit round repeat decrease rounds 1 & 2 10 times bottom ribbing * before starting 2x2 ribbing i always count my stitches to make sure they are a multiple of 4 just in case an increase or decreased was missed somewhere along the line switch to #6 needles work 2x2 ribbing until desired length i did 2 inches/ 5cm cast off when at desired length
